intro: Wahlenbergia itatiaiensis, commonly known as the Itatiaia bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
